data.title: David W. Lee, M.D. Interventional Spine & Pain Management
data.meta_description: David W. Lee, M.D. specializes in interventional spine and pain management. He uses a non-surgical approaches to treat both acute and chronic pain.
data.text:
Dr. Lee was fellowship trained in Interventional Spine at The Orthopedic Clinic Association (TOCA) in Phoenix, Arizona. He completed his residency training at the State University of New York (SUNY), Downstate and is Board Certified in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R) where he served as Chief Resident. He is graduated from the Chicago Medical School (CMS).

Dr. Lee holds over a decade worth of experience in the interventional spine and pain treatment, specializing in non-surgical treatment of a variety of pain conditions including:

​

Neck Pain

Back Pain

Failed Back Surgery

Sciatica

Degenerative Disc Disease

Spinal Stenosis

Sacroiliac Joint Pain

Osteoarthritis

Peripheral Neuropathy

Scoliosis

Sports-related Injuries

Dr. Lee is proud to offer the most up-to-date treatments to address pain symptoms. He is one of the few pain physicians in Orange County with specialized training in neuromodulation and minimally-invasive spinal procedures.

​

He remains an active member in multiple medical organizations, holding leadership positions over the past few years. He continues to teach and present on a variety of pain-related topics on both regional and national levels. He reviews interventional spine and pain manuscripts for the journals of Regional Anesthesia & Pain Medicine, Pain Medicine and PM&R.

​

Dr. Lee provides sports coverage from high school to the professional level in a wide variety of sports including football, hockey, baseball and basketball. He volunteers as the team physician for Esperanza High School Football Program. He serves as a Spine Consultant for the USA Volleyball Team.
